realTimeStatePreservation.mandatoryRequirement: After EVERY subtask completion, step completion, or any work unit completion, ALL organizational files and database records MUST be immediately updated
realTimeStatePreservation.purpose: Ensure seamless session restoration and prevent work loss from premature session termination
realTimeStatePreservation.atomicOperation: All updates must succeed or entire completion step fails and must be retried
realTimeStatePreservation.sessionRestorationGoal: AI must resume exactly where work left off with minimal review and zero lost progress
realTimeStatePreservation.instanceAwareness: Updates must be applied to current instance workspace (main or branch)

sidequests.purpose: Support multiple simultaneous sidequests for tangential work with configurable limits

multipleSidequestSupport.limitManagement: Check active count before creating, present options if exceeded
multipleSidequestSupport.subtaskTracking: Add relatedSidequests array to subtask structure for coordination

workflowPhases: Check Active Count: Query current sidequests across all subtasks
Validate Limits: Compare against maxSimultaneousSidequests setting
Context Preservation: Save complete task state before creating sidequest
Sidequest Activation: Pause parent task, switch AI focus completely to sidequest
Update Tracking: Add to current subtask's relatedSidequests array
Sidequest Completion: Update parent task if needed, archive sidequest, restore context, resume from exact pause point
sidequests.implementationNote: ROUTINE OPERATIONS REQUIRE: Load reference/directives/06-task-management.json for user communication protocols, limit management, and complete workflow specifications

contextSwitching.pause: Save current subtask ID, progress, loaded themes/files, exact position in flow
contextSwitching.resume: Restore exact subtask state and context, continue from pause point

strictBehavior: Check sidequest limit before creating new sidequests
Update subtask relatedSidequests array when creating/completing sidequests
NEVER continue parent task work while any sidequest is active
ALWAYS preserve complete context when creating sidequest
MUST restore exact context when resuming parent task
REQUIRED to communicate workflow transitions clearly to user

smartValidation.purpose: Prevent artificial restrictions that could cause AI to break connected functionality
smartValidation.approach: Validate references exist but allow AI discretionary context escalation
smartValidation.taskMilestoneReference: enforceTaskMilestoneReference - tasks must reference valid milestones
smartValidation.taskThemeReference: enforceTaskThemeReference - tasks must specify valid themes
smartValidation.flowReferenceValidation: smart mode (default) - validate flow references exist, allow cross-flow and context escalation
smartValidation.crossFlowAwareness: sidequests can reference any flows needed to address discovered issues during development
smartValidation.contextEscalationAllowed: AI can load related flows within theme scope without user approval
smartValidation.jsonSchemas: validateJsonSchemas - all JSON files must conform to schemas

preventingBrokenCode: AI can see full context to avoid breaking connected functionality
Flow scope is performance optimization, not artificial limitation
Theme scope provides safety boundary for complete understanding
Context escalation ensures holistic solutions over isolated fixes
qualityAssurance.dataIntegrity: Cross-reference consistency, file existence validation, dependency checking

escalationProtocol.level1Compressed: Start with directive-compressed.json for routine task execution and basic workflows only
escalationProtocol.level2JSON: Auto-escalate to reference/directives/{directive}.json for detailed implementation specifications. Always used for forced operations above.
escalationProtocol.level3MD: Auto-escalate to ../docs/directives/{directive}.md for comprehensive context, examples, and edge case handling when JSON insufficient
escalationProtocol.noUserApproval: AI can escalate to any level automatically based on need. No user approval required for any directive escalation.

forceJSON: Any operation with implementationNote in compressed directive

directiveEscalation.contextPreservation: Maintain findings from each escalation level to avoid re-reading same files
